alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Harding County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Quay County; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 2:43PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...GUSTY SNOW SHOWERS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL...HARDING... NORTHEASTERN QUAY...SOUTHERN UNION...NORTHEASTERN MORA AND SOUTHWESTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM MST... At 240 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Sedan to 7 miles southeast of Gladstone to near Maxwell to 11 miles south of Stonewall. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARDS...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, areas of blowing snow, and reduced visibility. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Springer, Wagon Mound, Mosquero, Amistad, Cimarron, Roy, Bueyeros, Hayden, Solano, and Philmont Scout Ranch. This includes portions of Interstate 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Harding County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Quay County; Union County
